letters.description: Conducting a comprehensive intake of sexual history, attachment styles, and bio-psycho-social health factors.
Providing evidence-based psychoeducation on sexual response cycles, anatomy, and sexual health myths.
Utilizing body-based mindfulness and sensory exercises to enhance the mind-body connection and arousal awareness.
Identifying and dismantling psychological barriers, shame, and societal conditioning that restrict sexual expression.
Implementing communication tools and vulnerability practices to bridge individual healing with interpersonal intimacy.
Establishing a sustainable sexual wellness plan that prioritizes personal agency, pleasure, and long-term autonomy.
